variable.tooltip: sets the motor voltage at Speed Step 1, range 0(default)-255, CV5
variable.comment: Range 0-255, 0 in CV 2, 6, 5 produces straight line acceleration
variable.label: Start voltage
variable.comment: Range 0-255, 0 in CV 2, 6, 5 produces straight line acceleration

variable.tooltip: Sets the acceleration rate (delay or momentum), range 0(default)-255, CV3
variable.label: Accel Base Rate (CV3)

variable.tooltip: Sets the deceleration rate (delay or momentum), range 0(default)-255, CV4
variable.label: Decel Base Rate (CV4)

variable.tooltip: sets the motor voltage at top throttle Speed Setting, range 0(default)-255, CV5
variable.comment: Range 0-255, A value of 255 corresponds to 100%. 0 in CV 2, 6, 5 produces straight line acceleration
variable.label: Maximum Voltage
variable.comment: Range 0-255, A value of 255 corresponds to 100%. 0 in CV 2, 6, 5 produces straight line acceleration

variable.tooltip: sets the motor voltage at midrange throttle Speed Setting, range 0(default)-255, CV5
variable.comment: Range 0-255, 0 in CV 2, 6, 5 produces straight line acceleration
variable.label: Midpoint Voltage
variable.comment: Range 0-255, 0 in CV 2, 6, 5 produces straight line acceleration

variable.tooltip: turn off BEMF above this speed step, default 0 (1-128), CV10

variable.tooltip: Decoder based consist set up
variable.label: Extended Address Low Byte
variable.comment: Default = 0 (Not part of a consist) Address range is 1-127 Add 128 to the address number to reverse direction of the locomotive.

Outputs 5,6 Flicker then on controlled by F3,4

label.label: If Accel 2, 3 and Decel 4, 5 are all set to zero,
base rates (CV3,CV4) apply to whole speed range
AE Models decoders offer a decoder locking mechanism
which can be useful when several decoders are used in one loco
on the same address, e.g. for adding sound
AE Models suggests values of 1=mobile, 2=sound, 3=light/function only
Set CV15 equal to this number to unlock the decoder for programming
To use the Decoder Lock (CV15) must be set manually from the single CV programmer, or make use of the multi-decoder tool
ABC Breaking Settings taken from DCC Concepts Zen V.12 Manual
